fields.label: Remove query string from static files
fields.name: remove_query_strings
fields.instructions: Some servers and proxy servers are unable to cache query strings, even if a cache-control:public header is present. So by removing them, you can sometimes improve your caching.

fields.label: Remove Emoji Support
fields.name: remove_emoji
fields.instructions: Removes the extra markup in the header that calls for emoji support.  If you don't have any use for emoji's, it's nice to clean up the header.

fields.label: Remove WP Version
fields.name: remove_wp_version
fields.instructions: As an extra security precaution, it is often recommended to remove the version number from being displayed on your site.

fields.label: Remove RSS
fields.name: remove_rss
fields.instructions: In some cases you may not require offering an RSS feed.  Simply switch to off to disable it.

fields.label: Remove XML-RPC
fields.name: remove_xml_rpc
fields.instructions: If you want to access and publish to your blog remotely, then you need XML-RPC enabled.  Removing enhances security if ever a vulnerability would potentially be exposed.

fields.label: Remove Comments System
fields.name: remove_comments_system
fields.instructions: If your site is not utilizing the comments system for blog posts, this can be handy to remove all the extra markup not needed.

fields.label: Google Tag Manager
fields.name: add_extra_js
fields.instructions: Here you can add the Google Tag Manager ID and it will put the script on all site pages.

fields.label: Google Tag ID
fields.name: extra_js
fields.instructions: If you have something small javascript pieces you can it here.

fields.label: Pardot Script
fields.name: add_pardot_js
fields.instructions: Here you can add your pardot script to the footer.

fields.label: Nav Button (Shows on desktop and in mobile nav)
fields.name: nav_button

fields.label: Phone
fields.name: f_phone
fields.instructions: Only enter the phone number in this field

fields.label: What is a CTA?
fields.message: These call to action cards are located on individual pages specified by the name of the CTA in this area: Blog Posts, Press Posts, and Location Posts. See example below:
